rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {4439}
Must be enrolled in course version {4439}

description: This unit focuses on the tools for a large, digital data world, including the building blocks for business analytics, modern insurance and risk assessment.  A computational approach is employed to teach the concepts of statistics, and decision making in the presence of uncertainty.  An important aspect will be to develop skills for compiling data from multiple sources to support better decisions and models. Topics covered will include simulation and randomisation methods, decision and credibility theory, data wrangling and visualisation, methods for time series, Bayesian analysis, models for risk and loss distributions.
